conclusion: Analyze the paths of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid flows downward from A and encounters a red baffle.
Liquid flows downward from B and encounters a green baffle.
Liquid flows downward from C and encounters a green baffle.
Liquid from A is directed left by the red baffle and flows into container E.
Liquid from B is directed right by the green baffle and flows into container D.
Liquid from C is directed right by the green baffle and flows into container D.
Liquid from A flows into container E, and liquid from B and C flows into container D.
Final Answer: Liquid will flow into container D from B and C, and into container E from A.
